column4: Is it possible to use gnome 2 on the latest version of ubuntu?
No, you can use the Gnome3 fallback, though. Or XFCE ^_^
do i just download the normal version for gnome 3? also, if i wanted to change it i could just install another one right?

You can apt-get install gnome-shell to use the traditional GNOME3 interface, gnome-panel to use the old-style gnome2-like one (note that you can not add or remove applets) or xfce4 in order to use XFCE (which is VERY gnome2-like)
